info.title: Operate
info.description: Run various operations on the data - modify, update, read, search, match, merge and more.

post.summary: Exports activities from a tenant
post.description:
This API exports activities from a tenant, uploads a CSV file or JSON file to the appropriate storage, and sends a link to the exported data (if post-processing is enabled and the partSize parameter was not specified) or a link to the Export Console UI page (in the other cases) to your email address.

Note: For details about S3, GCS, or an Azure Storage destination for export, please see Storing Export Results. Only one storage destination can be specified for one export request.

By default, the Activity Log Export API returns results for the last four months. To retrieve data for a different time range, specify the filter query parameter for timestamp. For example, by using the filter=gt(timestamp,1560800276000) query, all activities more recent than June 17, 2019, 7:37:56 PM are returned. The timestamp must be mentioned in milliseconds.

Note: As a best practice, we recommend that you specify the time period filter when searching/exporting the activity log data.

Retention, exporting, and searching against the activity log data is governed by Quotas and Limits. For more information, please see Quotas and Limits.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: s3Bucket
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the S3 bucket by name

parameters.name: s3Region
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the S3 region. Specify the S3 region parameter to bypass region autodetection

parameters.name: s3Path
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the S3 path. Specifying the leading slash is optional

parameters.name: s3Sse
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the server–side encryption algorithm (AES256 or aws:kms). The parameter is ignored if the s3Bucket parameter is not specified (export to Reltio bucket)

parameters.name: s3SseKmsKey
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the custom KMS key for server side encryption

parameters.name: awsAccessKey
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the AWS access key ID. The account must have Write permissions for the S3 destination

parameters.name: awsSecretKey
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the AWS secret key

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Indicates the AWS role for cross-account secured export

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: S3

Additional security over delegate role access (Assume Role) to control the access to custom S3 bucket

parameters.name: gcsBucket
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: GCS

Indicates the GCS bucket by name

parameters.name: gcsPath
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: GCS

Indicates the GCS path. Specifying the leading slash is optional

parameters.name: gcpCredentials
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: GCS

Indicates the GCP credentials JSON. The account must have Write permissions on the GCS destination

parameters.name: azureStorageContainer
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: Azure Storage

Indicates the Azure container

parameters.name: azureStorageAccountName
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: Azure Storage

Indicates the Azure account name. The account must have Write permissions on the Azure destination

parameters.name: azureStorageAccountKey
parameters.description:
Custom storage destination: Azure Storage

Indicates the Azure account name. The account must have Write permissions on the Azure destination

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the comma-separated list of custom email addresses to which the notification is sent after the export is completed. If the parameter is not specified, the Export Service notifies the Reltio user who submitted the export request

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the format of the date and time attribute values

parameters.name: fileFormat
parameters.description: This parameter defines what output format must be used for export. Note that export to JSON is more efficient compared to export to CSV

parameters.name: distributed
parameters.description: This parameter is applied only for Export Version 1. If set to true, then the export task is divided into parts that can be executed in parallel on different nodes. If not specified, then one task is created

parameters.name: taskPartsCount
parameters.description: This parameter is applied only for Export Version 1. It indicates the number of distributed task parts. This parameter is used only when the distributed parameter is set to true. If not specified, then auto-calculated number of tasks are created

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates a filter condition to filter activity log items.
The format is the same as that for the ActivityLogRecordsSearch request. For more information, see Filtering Activities

parameters.name: partSize
parameters.description: This parameter indicates a human-readable part size. The Export Service splits result files depending on this setting. For more information, please see Export Data into Multiple Files

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: This parameter indicates a name of the export task displayed in the task status. The name is also used by the Export UI. For more information, please see Naming an Export Job

parameters.name: skipPostprocessing
parameters.description: During data extraction, the Export Service generates multiple smaller in size, partial files that contain export results. If this parameter is enabled, the Export Service returns links to these files as the result, and the partSize parameter is ignored. Otherwise, the Export Service combines the partial files into one or several files depending on the partSize parameter and returns links to the combined files as the result. The default value is false for Export Version 1 and true for Export Version 2

parameters.name: filenameTemplate
parameters.description:
It defines a filename template that will be used to generate filenames. A filename template might contain the {{n}} placeholder, the Export Service will replace that placeholder with actual file numbers. If the placeholder is not specified, the Export Service will add file numbers at the end of filenames.
Allowed characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, -
Max length: 512
A filename template cannot be empty:
"" - invalid
"x{{n}}" - valid

Examples:
filenameTemplate → result files:
unspecified → part-00000.zip, part-00001.zip, part-00002.zip, ...
export-file → export-file-00000.zip, export-file-00001.zip, export-file-00002.zip, ...
results-{{n}} → results-00000.zip, results-00001.zip, results-00002.zip, ...

requestBody.description:
Object containing the filter parameter for activity log export

Note: If the filter parameter is present in the query and body, the query/filter parameter has priority and overrides the body/filter parameter

example.details: Export job has been scheduled. Result will be sent to your email: user@example.com

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the comma-separated list of custom email addresses to which the notification is sent after the export is completed. If the parameter is not specified, the Export Service notifies the Reltio user who submitted the export request

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the format of the date and time attribute values

parameters.name: fileFormat
parameters.description: This parameter defines what output format must be used for export. Note that export to JSON is more efficient compared to export to CSV

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: This parameter enables you to filter entities by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*). For more information, see Filtering Entities.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: This parameter accepts a list of entity fields to be exported. If not specified, then all fields are present in export.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • searchByOv - Disabled by default, to search by attributes with Operational Values (OV) only.

parameters.name: partSize
parameters.description: This parameter indicates a human-readable part size. The Export Service splits result files depending on this setting. For more information, please see Export Data into Multiple Files

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description:
This parameter determines how the Export Service should process active and expired objects.
Possible values:
  • ALL - This option enables exporting of active and expired objects. This is the default value.
  • ACTIVE - This option enables only exporting of active objects.
  • NOT_ACTIVE - This option enables only exporting of expired objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: This parameter indicates a name of the export task displayed in the task status. The name is also used by the Export UI. For more information, please see Naming an Export Job

parameters.name: headersStyle
parameters.description:
This parameter defines how the Export Service must name the CSV columns that represent the attribute values.
It is only applicable for CSV export.

parameters.name: skipPostprocessing
parameters.description: During data extraction, the Export Service generates multiple smaller in size, partial files that contain export results. If this parameter is enabled, the Export Service returns links to these files as the result, and the partSize parameter is ignored. Otherwise, the Export Service combines the partial files into one or several files depending on the partSize parameter and returns links to the combined files as the result. The default value is false for Export Version 1 and true for Export Version 2

parameters.name: exploded
parameters.description:
This parameter is only applicable for CSV export. If the parameter is specified and equals to true, then all attribute values for the same attribute must be within one column (multiple rows will be used for one entity). In other words, if the parameter equals to true, then each entity is represented as a set of CSV lines, where the set is a cartesian product of the entity's attributes. There is a restriction to explode up to 100K rows per one entity.

For more information, see Exploded format in CSV entities export.

parameters.name: filenameTemplate
parameters.description:
It defines a filename template that will be used to generate filenames. A filename template might contain the {{n}} placeholder, the Export Service will replace that placeholder with actual file numbers. If the placeholder is not specified, the Export Service will add file numbers at the end of filenames.
Allowed characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, -
Max length: 512
A filename template cannot be empty:
"" - invalid
"x{{n}}" - valid

Examples:
filenameTemplate → result files:
unspecified → part-00000.zip, part-00001.zip, part-00002.zip, ...
export-file → export-file-00000.zip, export-file-00001.zip, export-file-00002.zip, ...
results-{{n}} → results-00000.zip, results-00001.zip, results-00002.zip, ...

parameters.name: sendHidden
parameters.description: This parameter allows to include or exclude "hidden" attributes to the export result. By default all "hidden" attributes are included.

parameters.name: anchorAttribute
parameters.description: This parameter is only applicable for CSV export. Specifies an anchor attribute, it will precede all attributes, only a single OV value will be present on a CSV line for an entity. If it's used in combination with the slicedByCrosswalks option, the value will be put on each CSV line no matter which crosswalk that value belongs to. This option is not affected by the select parameter.

parameters.name: slicedByCrosswalks
parameters.description: This parameter is only applicable for CSV export. If true, objects will be sliced by crosswalks, each set of attribute values will be placed on a separate CSV line that represents a crosswalk these attributes belong to. This option cannot be used in combination with the exploded option.

requestBody.description:
Object containing any of the following parameters for entities export:
  • ovOnly
  • includeType
  • updateTimeFilter
  • groupBy
  • headerFormat
  • headerOrder
  • filter

Note: If the filter parameter is present in the query and body, the query/filter parameter has priority and overrides the body/filter parameter

post.summary: Exports the merge tree data for all entities in a tenant
post.description:
This endpoint allows you to export the merge tree data for all entities in a tenant. This is an asynchronous request that returns the IDs of tasks, which export data. Using these IDs you can track the status of these tasks. After completion of the tasks, a link to the result files is sent to the specified email address.
The file with the exported data is a multi-line text file and every line has a separate JSON object that stands for one entity merge tree:
  • <Contributor Tree JSON Node>
  • <Contributor Tree JSON Node>

get.summary: Returns active export tasks for all tenants
get.description:
This API is available to everyone and returns export tasks for all tenants with the statuses:
  • SCHEDULED - Indicates that the task is ready to be executed.
  • SCHEDULED_POLL - Indicates that the task is rescheduled due to a node failure or waiting for other tasks to complete their work.
  • PROCESSING - Indicates that the task is being executed now.
  • PAUSING - Indicates that the task is preparing to turn into the PAUSED status.
  • PAUSED - Indicates that the task was paused.
  • CANCELING - Indicates that the task is preparing to turn into the CANCELED status.
  • WAITING - Indicates that the task is waiting for other tasks that belong to the same export job.

put.description:
You can choose to publish the model for internal and external matching. If you select:

EXTERNAL_MATCH - the model is used to match data from an external file with the data in the tenant.
TENANT - the model is used to match the data within your tenant along with the match rules configured for the tenant. In the case, you can select the type of matching to be performed as shown below.

You cannot publish the model if there are rebuild match table jobs running. You must wait till the job is completed

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: ID of the flow

parameters.name: forcePublish
parameters.description: If this parameter is set to "true", the model is forced published

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

429.description: Thrown in two conditions.1) when there is already a published flow for the same scope(s). If you want to publish regardless, please set forcePublish flag to true2) If there is already a rebuild match table running. Please wait till the job is completed before trying again

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

503.description: This status code could represent 2 possible scenarios. First, the 'Service Unavailable' scenario. Second, this status code is used when too many requests are being sent in-parallel and API backpressure mechanism was used to protect the platform. In both scenarios, an exponential backoff mechanism should be used to control the rate of requests sent to the server.

507.description: The request consumes more resources than it is allowed

get.summary: Download the exported match report file
get.description:
You can review this file to evaluate the model for matching performance.
The results are downloaded in the ZIP file format. The ZIP file comprises a CSV file that contains a sample set of match results.
The CSV also contains a column called relevance that contains the relevance score of the matched recordsIf you are satisfied with the results, you can approve the model. Only an approved model can be published and used. You can only publish an approved model and use it. Use this API to download the sample match results. If the results are satisfactory, use the "Approve" API to approve the model. Otherwise, use the "Resume Train" API to retrain the model

parameters.description: ID of the flow

get.summary: Healthcheck
get.description:
Etalon healthcheck
Returns: (dict)
    version: (str) digest of code, commit date, branch name
    status: (str) "OK" or "Problem"

get.summary: Status
get.description:
Etalon service status
Returns: (dict)
    memory: (dict)
        JVM_heap_size: (int) since this is not a JVM, we return whatever Memory_used is
        Memory_used: (int) memory used by python process
        Max_memory: (int) MAX_MEMORY
    <servicename>: (dict)
        developer-definable stats in a stat-provider object

get.summary: Version
get.description:
Etalon service version & platform ID information
Returns: (dict)
    platformID: (str) uuid4 string provided as PLATFORM_ID env var
    <module_name>: (dict) version info for each module stored in the VERSIONS_PATH
        (see ModuleVersionInfo.as_dict)

get.summary: Admin Systemconfig
get.description:
Etalon service config
Secrets should be masked, but for our services, secrets are not
permitted in the config anyways, and are checked for by the
precommit hooks.
Returns: (dict) - this is whatever is in CONFIG

get.summary: List Lookup Codes API retrieves the complete list of lookup codes in RDM tenant.
get.description: The response includes all the lookup codes along with their respective contributor sources. In addition, localization information and lookup hierarchies are also returned.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the RDM tenant.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "limit" parameter.
Note: The "limit" and "offset" parameters, when combined, must not exceed the value of 10,000 if they are using along with "filter", "sort" or "order" parameters. Some examples of valid combinations are:
  • offset=9900 and limit=100
  • offset=9800 and limit=200

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "offset" parameter. Maximum value of the limit parameter is 1000.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filters lookup values by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*). This API supports the following properties for filters:
  • type - lookup type name
  • code - lookup code
  • value - lookup value
  • enabled - status of a lookup value
  • startDate - date when the lookup value will be enabled
  • endDate - date when a lookup value will be disabled
  • parents - parents of a lookup value
  • code_SOURCE - code in source mappings for the specified source system. Example, "code_Reltio"
  • value_SOURCE - value in source mappings for the specified source system. Example, "value_Reltio"
  • updateDate - lookup last update date
  • updatedBy - user who did the last update
    • For more information, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the results based on a property, such as type, code, value and so on.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the sort parameter. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

post.summary: Transcodes a hierarchy of lookup values to the canonical form
post.description:
Transcoding is a process of converting a source system value to the canonical value and it's details. This process can be used to standardize reference data from multiple sources.

Use language code in Accept-Language header if you need to get localized value or do not specify it to get canonical value.

Use targetSource query parameter to define a target source system for transcoding value from source system in the request to the target source system. If targetSource is not specified or contains a non-existing source system, API request will return a canonical value.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the RDM tenant

parameters.name: targetSource
parameters.description: Target source system

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Language code

requestBody.description: Specifies a hierarchy of lookup values that needs to be transcoded

get.summary: Allows to search Data Change Request by users and/or URIs of the affected objects
get.description:
Allows to search Data Change Request by users (createdBy field) and/or URIs of the affected objects. The filter must contain at least one "equals" or "in" condition for createdBy or objectURI properties, otherwise, CHANGE_REQUEST_SEARCH_FILTER_INCORRECT error will be returned.

Note: the search and filtering is supported only for createdBy and objectURI (URIs of affected objects in the Data Change Request).

Note: only Data Change Requests which are allowed to be viewed by the user according to the permissions can be returned.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables data change request filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter:

filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)

Only the following conditions are supported:
  • equals(property, 'value') - exact match condition
  • in(property,'value1,value2,...') - returns Data Change Requests which have property value contained in the specified values list
Search by the following properties is supported:
  • createdBy
  • objectURI
Note:
  • Search is case sensitive
  • Empty filter is not allowed

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify the maximum number of Data Change Requests to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify the starting element in a result set to be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties from Data Change Request structure that should be returned in a response. Allows to return a partial object. The list of properties can be found at the response model

200.description: Data Change Requests which matched the filter is successfully returned

400.description: Can't search Data Change Request due to a reason provided in the error message

post.summary: Applies (commits) all changes inside the Data Change Request to real entities and relationships
post.description:
By default, the Data Change Request can be applied only if all attributes which are going to be updated by this change request have not been changed in real objects since they have been added to this request. Otherwise, items inside the Data Change Request related to the attributes which have been changed/removed in the real object will be marked as 'conflict'. The user will have to manually resolve all conflicts by removing and optionally re-adding items into the Data Change Request. Also, it's possible to execute 'ignoreConflicts' apply (with ignoreConflicts=true parameter) - all changes will be applied 'as is' in this case.

For example, there is a change request with only one item: update 'FirstName' attribute in entity AAA from 'Alex' to 'Alexey'. If the value of the 'FirstName' attribute of entity AAA is still 'Alex' it will be possible to apply this change request. But if 'Alex' has been changed to 'Aleks' or removed, we will have a conflict.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a Data Change Request

parameters.name: ignoreConflicts
parameters.description: Allows to apply Data Change Requests even if change items have conflicts

200.description: Data Change Request is successfully applied

400.description: Can't apply Data Change Request due to a reason provided in the error message

get.summary: Search or Get Entities API retrieves entities
get.description:
This API retrieves the individual entities or searches for multiple entities. The response can include a maximum of 200 entities.
If the request consists of the select parameter, then ensure that there is no space between the query parameters. For example: select=URI,label,attributes._lookupCodes,attributes._lookupValues

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*).
For more information, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of properties from object structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial object. List of object properties you can find at the response model. Additional system properties are:
  • attributes._lookupCodes: return codes for lookup attributes.
  • attributes._lookupValues: return values for lookup attributes.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "offset" parameter.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Entity objects property that should be used for sorting. Can be used in combination with the "order" parameter to have reverse order. If this parameter is not provided or if the value cannot be recognized, then no sorting is used.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the sort parameter. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • nonOvOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="false" will be present in the resulting JSON. This option is mutually exclusive with the ovOnly option. Has a lower priority than ovOnly
  • ovOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="true" will be present in the resulting JSON
  • searchByOv - Disabled by default, to search by attributes with Operational Values (OV) only.
  • sendHidden - Specifies whether the hidden attributes will appear in the response

parameters.name: defaultMaxValues
parameters.description: Specifies maximum number of values listed in attributes. This restriction is intended for more efficient responses in the case of very long lists of values in some attributes.

parameters.name: scoreEnabled
parameters.description: When set to true, documents with search hits in labels get more search relevance score.

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description:
Defines whether to include active and expired entities into the results. By default, only active entities are included in the response. Possible values:
  • all - include both active and expired entities
  • active - include only active entities
  • not_active - include only expired entities

delete.description: This API deletes all entities of the specified type from a tenant

parameters.description: This parameter denotes the entity type to be deleted. All entities of the specified type are deleted

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
This is an optional parameter indicating whether entities of provided type gets completely removed from the system or only flagged as deleted. The possible parameter values are:
  • soft (default)- Entities are to be deleted by flagging records
  • hard - Entities are to be completely removed from storage

post.summary: Delete Entity History API deletes the history of an entity.
post.description:
This API performs bulk delete of history and activity logs for either a single entity or multiple entities. To use this API, you must have the DELETE privilege for the MDM.Data.Entities.History resource (or ROLE_ADMIN_TENANT). You can specify the URIs of the entities in the request body of the API. A maximum of 100 URIs can be specified in a single request.
For all the specified entities, complete history and activity log entries are removed by default. The system retains the entity URI and type details from the first and last entries only. However, if you want to retain all the details in the first and last entries, you must enable the retainAuditTrail option.

Additionally, when you delete the history/activity details of an entity, Reltio automatically deletes the history/activity details of the related loser entities as well. Similarly, if a loser entity is sent for history/activity deletion, then the system looks up all the related loser entities and the winner entity and deletes the history/activity details of all the related entities.

After you delete entities’ history/activity log, if you use the GET /entities/id1?time={currentTimeInMillis} API call to view the details of entities based on the value of the specified time, a blank display appears as the Time parameter uses the entity history to show the details. However, if a change was made to the entity after its history was deleted, the system shows those results. You can use the GET Entities API to view the entity details.

Note: To keep the information in the entity's first and last entries as is, you must enable the retainAuditTrail option.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • retainAuditTrail - This option declares, whether or not boundary values should be cleared in DeleteEntityHistoryOperation

requestBody.description: Array of entities URIs to delete history and activity log. Limit for number of entities URIs per request is 100.

400.description: The max number of objects that history can be deleted per 1 request is 100

post.summary: Search Potential Matches with Score API returns all matches for the supplied set of entities along with the match score
post.description: The matches returned in the response are the ones that are identified by all match rules. In addition to match pairs, this API also returns their corresponding match scores

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: Defines match rule URIs to be used in matching

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify maximum number of matches to return in a response. This parameter can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. The API can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties from the entity structure that must be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial entity object. Example: select=uri,label,attributes,crosswalks from the referenced object. To ensure improved performance of _scoredMatches, properly define the properties list in the select parameter. The possible variants are: - 'uri' and/or 'type' (select=uri,type). No objects are loaded. The most efficient and recommended way; - Simple or nested attributes from the object are specified. A lightweight operation is performed to retrieve the object without references; - no 'select'; 'select=attributes', contains some reference attributes that are loaded with the object. The above mentioned optimizations work only if there is no configured data security for the entity type, else the object is loaded fully. If there are a a large number of matches for input entities, then the response size can be very large. The size is limited to 100 MB. In such a case, it is recommended to reduce the number of input entities and decrease the value of the max parameter. If the Request has the select parameter, there must not be any space between the query parameters

post.summary: Explains how a given pair of records are matched using the applicable match rules
post.description: his can be used for the tuning of match rules and/or for troubleshooting why any pair matched or did not match. The API accepts either the URIs of existing objects or any two records with attribute values. The explanation can be invoked using the existing match groups by default or with the custom match rules

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: The match group URIs to calculate the match explanation

parameters.name: hashedTokens
parameters.description: The match tokens might be hashed. The parameter allows you to request the non-hashed values.

parameters.name: show
parameters.description:
Determines the information that is returned in the response. The user can assign the following values:
  • brief: Returns only rules and their explanations (current behavior).
  • full: Returns information about match documents values and entities versions.

parameters.name: documentsFromDatabase
parameters.description: The default value is false. If set to true, for existing entities, their actual documents from database are used for explanation. If set to false, the documents are generated by the input entities (default behavior)

parameters.name: checkOvercollisionedTokens
parameters.description: If set to true the match token phrases are checked if they are marked in the database as overcollisioned, if yes the match token phrases are represented as overcollisioned and removed from intersection list. If set to false the tokens lists might contain overcollisioned tokens.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The point in time for which the matches explanation is required

requestBody.description: The entities to get the explanation of the match with the existing and custom match groups

summary: There are common match tokens. These entities are considered as match candidates and will be checked according to the list of common applicable match rules.
There are bypassed rules for the given entity type. Bypassed match rules are not participated in the matching.

Parsing Status isidentified and parsed - All input data has been able to be identified and placed into components.
Lexicon Identification Match Level is 2 - locality.

get.summary: This API retrieves the history of the specified entity.
get.description:
This API retrieves the timestamps (UTC) reflecting when an entity was modified, the user who made the change and type of change, for example ENTITY_CHANGED, ENTITY_CREATED.
Note: There is a hard limit of 1000 most recent events retrieved from the database.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the history is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with "offset" parameter.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with "max" parameter.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)
There are tree Condition Types:
  • equals(property, value): exact match condition ignoring case
  • lt(property, value): 'less than' condition
  • lte(property, value): 'less than or equals' condition
  • gt(property, value): 'greater than' condition
  • gte(property, value): 'greater than' or 'equals' condition
  • changes(attribute): match changes for a specific attributes
The 'equals' match condition is applicable for filtering users, who made changes, for history event type, and for timestamps. The 'lt', 'lte', 'gt', and 'gte' conditions are applicable only for timestamps. The 'changes' condition is applicable only for filtering events with certain attribute changes. For more information see https://docs.reltio.com/entitiesapi/entitiesfiltering.html

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • skipReferenceAttributesProcessing - This option declares, whether or not new deltas for reference attributes should be calculated in GetBusinessObjectChangesOperation

parameters.name: historicURIs
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the subset of entity URIs (entity URIs delimited by comma) returned by _historicURIs request. The result contains history tree events for the current entity and for entities specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: showAll

get.summary: Entity History with count of changes retrieves the history of changes in an entity along with total number of entity changes.
get.description: This API is an extension of the Entity History (GET {TenantURL} /entities/{entity object URI}/_changes) request. It works in the same way (retrieves the history of changes in an entity), but additionally returns the total number of entity changes.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the history is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with "offset" parameter.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with "max" parameter.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)
There are tree Condition Types:
  • equals(property, value): exact match condition ignoring case
  • lt(property, value): 'less than' condition
  • lte(property, value): 'less than or equals' condition
  • gt(property, value): 'greater than' condition
  • gte(property, value): 'greater than' or 'equals' condition
  • changes(attribute): match changes for a specific attributes
The 'equals' match condition is applicable for filtering users, who made changes, for history event type, and for timestamps. The 'lt', 'lte', 'gt', and 'gte' conditions are applicable only for timestamps. The 'changes' condition is applicable only for filtering events with certain attribute changes. For more information see https://docs.reltio.com/entitiesapi/entitiesfiltering.html

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • skipReferenceAttributesProcessing - This option declares, whether or not new deltas for reference attributes should be calculated in GetBusinessObjectChangesOperation

parameters.name: historicURIs
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the subset of entity URIs (entity URIs delimited by comma) returned by _historicURIs request. The result contains history tree events for the current entity and for entities specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: showAll
parameters.description: This parameter specifies if the response must contain all historical events, despite any real changes on attributes. Filter is ignored if the showAll parameter is set to true.

post.summary: Get entity one-hop connections
post.description:
This request returns a paginated list of direct connections for a specific entity that match conditions. A connection for an entity is a pair of a relation and a connected entity. A condition can be setup by:

  • Type and direction of relations
  • Type of connected entities
  • Page size and offset
  • Filters on entities and relations properties

Note: there is the limit of relations per entity for this request. If an entity has more than 500K relations, then only the first 500K of relations will be read from the primary store and will be used to build the response. If it happens, then the additional property - "limitExceeded": true - will be added to the response.

parameters.description: Entity ID

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • searchByOv - Disabled by default, to search by attributes with Operational Values (OV) only.

get.summary: Returns entities and relations traversed with an N-hop operation.
get.description:
This API returns entities and relations traversed with an N-hop operation. There is a limit of 1,500 entities that can be returned per API call.

Collections of traversed entities and relations with default details:

  • Relations:
    • uri: URI of a relation
    • type: type of a relation
    • startObject: contains information about the start object URI, and the directionalLabel object
    • endObject: contains information about the end object URI, and the directionalLabel object
    • Properties defined in select parameter
  • Entities:
    • uri: URI of an entity that is traversed
    • type: type of an entity
    • label: label of an entity
    • Properties defined in select parameter
    • traversedRelationsCount: number of relations of an entity that were traversed with this operation
    • untraversedRelationsCount: number of relations of an entity that were not traversed with this operation

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the information is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of properties from object structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial object. List of object properties you can find at the response model. Additional system properties are:
  • attributes._lookupCodes: return codes for lookup attributes.
  • attributes._lookupValues: return values for lookup attributes.

parameters.name: graphTypeURIs
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of graph types URIs for graphs to be traversed.

parameters.name: relationTypeURIs
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of relation type URIs for relation to be traversed.

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: Limits traversing deep levels.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Limits the amount of entities to be returned from the API. If the number of entities does not fit into the specified level, then only entities from previous levels are returned.

parameters.name: returnInactive
parameters.description: Flag to traverse inactive entities/relationships.

parameters.name: filterLastLevel
parameters.description: Flag to NOT count relationships from the last level of deep to the next level after the last. In a response it affects these entity parameters: untraversedRelationsCount and traversedRelationsCount.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • nonOvOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="false" will be present in the resulting JSON. This option is mutually exclusive with the ovOnly option. Has a lower priority than ovOnly
  • ovOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="true" will be present in the resulting JSON
  • sendHidden - Specifies whether the hidden attributes will appear in the response

parameters.name: limitCreditsConsumption
parameters.description: Flag to limit Credits consumption. In this case heavy operations will throw HTTP 507 error.

parameters.name: returnDataAnyway
parameters.description: Flag to return data anyway. If request with limitCreditConsumption and returnDataAnyway and credits consumption limit for the request is reached then will ignore sorting and filtering to return whatever data is fetched

parameters.name: activeness_date
parameters.description: Timestamp in milliseconds. With this parameter the response will contain active relations and entities which have "endDate" > activeness_date.

parameters.name: activeness_enabled
parameters.description: If this flag is false the response will contain both active and inactive entities and relations, i.e. regardless "endDate" values for them.

get.summary: Get Interactions for an Entity API retrieves interactions for an entity.
get.description:
This API retrieves a list of interactions for an entity (interactions, where this entity is the member). You can sort (using the sort and order parameters) and filter (using the filter parameter) interactions in the response. By default, the retrieved interactions are sorted using the timestamp property in descending order.
Note: There is a limit for reading interactions from the database for tenant. Only this amount of interactions are read from the database and only these interactions participate in filtering and sorting. If there are more interactions in the database for the given entity, then it means that the fetchedAll property is set to false in the response.
If you want to change the maximum number of interactions received for one entity, please contact Reltio support.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the list of interactions must be retrieved.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the interactions must be retrieved.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. The API can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description:
This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify maximum number of interactions to return in a response. This parameter can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter.
There is a limit for reading interactions from the database for tenant. If you want to change the maximum number of interactions received for one entity, please contact Reltio support

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
This parameter enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for the filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)
For more information about search filter, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
This parameter indicates the interaction objects property that must be used for sorting and can be used in combination with the order parameter to have the reverse order. If this parameter is not provided or if the value cannot be recognized, then no sorting is used.
By default, the retrieved interactions are sorted using the timestamp property in descending order.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
This parameter denotes the order of sorting and can be used in combination with the sort parameter to have the reverse order.
Following are the possible values -
  • asc - Results are displayed in ascending order
  • desc - Results are displayed in descending order
The default order of sorting is desc.

get.summary: Get Potential Matches API returns all potential matches for a particular entity
get.description: The potential matches returned in the response are the ones that are identified by Suspect match rules. The information returned in the response can be controlled using the parameters supported by this API

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity

parameters.name: transitive
parameters.description: Flag to return transitive matches as a separate group. If set to true the transitive matches would be presented in 'transitive' block. Otherwise, the transitive matches would be presented with the direct matches as a single list

parameters.name: forceMatch
parameters.description: Flag for calculating matches in real time. If set to true potential matches for particular entity would be recalculated. Otherwise, potential matches would be taken from the database.

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify the maximum depth of transitive matches. To get direct matches only the parameter should be set to 1

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify the maximum number of matches to return in a response. This parameter can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. The API can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description: Parameter describing what kind of entities should be returned.When it is set to ACTIVE, only active entities are listed in the response for the potential matches. When it is set to NOT_ACTIVE, only inactive entities are listed in the response for the potential matches. Otherwise, all entities are listed as potential matches

parameters.name: showObject
parameters.description: URI of a matched entity. The parameter could be used for pagination instead of offset. If specified, the result will be a page containing the required matched entity

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the matches to search for. The possible value is either one of the predefined match group type (suspect, automatic, relevance_based) or one of the predefined match actions (potential_match, auto_merge) or one of the custom match action types

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Name of the property that should be used for sorting. Possible value is 
"relevance" - relevance will be used for sorting.
"relevanceScores.relevance" - relevance will be used for sorting.
"actionLabel" - Match action label corresponding to the relevance value will be used for sorting.
"relevanceScores.actionLabel" - Match action label corresponding to the relevance value will be used for sorting.
If not provided or value can't be recognized - no sorting will be used

parameters.name: order

post.summary: Manually merging of two entities
post.description: This API can be used to manually merge two entities. One of the entities (the oldest one by default) will be selected as "winner" and all attributes, crosswalks, roles, and tags from the second "loser" entity will be moved to the "winner". After the merge, the resulting entity can be accessed by both URIs through the API. An ENTITIES_MERGED_MANUALLY event (match queue) with URI of "loser" in uris field and ENTITY_CHANGED event (CRUD queue) will be generated for the "winner". An ENTITY_LOST_MERGE event (CRUD queue) will be generated for "loser".

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the first entity to merge

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: ID or URI of the second entity to merge

parameters.name: explicitWinner
parameters.description: URI of the first or the second entity. Can be used to explicitly define which of two entities will be selected as "winner"

202.description: Entities are successfully merged, the resulting entity is returned

400.description: Entities were not merged due to a reason provided in the error message

get.summary: Get Transitive Matches API returns potential matches with the shortest transitive path for a particular entity
get.description: Transitive matches are records that matched with the potential matches of an entityThe information returned in the response can be controlled using the parameters supported by this API

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity

parameters.name: showPath
parameters.description: Specifies if the shortest transitive path must be returned

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify the maximum depth of transitive matches

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify the maximum number of matches to return in a response. This parameter can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This parameter denotes a positive integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. The API can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description: Parameter describing what kind of entities should be returned.When it is set to ACTIVE, only active entities are listed in the response for the potential matches. When it is set to NOT_ACTIVE, only inactive entities are listed in the response for the potential matches. Otherwise, all entities are listed as potential matches

parameters.name: showObject
parameters.description: URI of a matched entity. The parameter could be used for pagination instead of offset. If specified, the result will be a page containing the required matched entity

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: This parameter allows to filter matched entities by particular sources

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: This parameter allows to return matching results for particular match rules

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Name of the property that should be used for sorting. Possible value is 
"score" - match score will be used for sorting.
"relevance" - relevance will be used for sorting.
"relevanceScores.relevance" - relevance will be used for sorting.
"actionLabel" - Match action label corresponding to the relevance value will be used for sorting.
"relevanceScores.actionLabel" - Match action label corresponding to the relevance value will be used for sorting.
"attributes.<attribute_name>" - attribute value (OV only) will be used for sorting.
If not provided or value can't be recognized - no sorting will be used

parameters.name: order
type
parameters.description: Type of the matches to search for. The possible value is either one of the predefined match group type (suspect, automatic, relevance_based) or one of the predefined match actions (potential_match, auto_merge) or one of the custom match action types

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*). For more information, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

post.summary: Unmerge a part of an entity
post.description: If an entity is composite (result of merge), every component (contributor) can be unmerged to be a standalone entity again. Let us call the composite entity "origin" and the unmerging one "spawn". An ENTITIES_SPLITTED event (CRUD queue) with URI of "spawn" in uris field and ENTITY_CHANGED event (CRUD queue) will be generated for the "origin". An ENTITY_CREATED event (CRUD queue) will be generated for "spawn".

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of an entity from which a contributor will be unmerged

parameters.name: contributorURI
parameters.description: URI of the contributor (some other entity that has been merged to "origin" previously) to unmerge

200.description: Entities are successfully unmerged, the resulting entities are returned

400.description: Entities were not unmerged due to a reason provided in the error message

get.summary: Searches for interactions in a tenant
get.description: This API searches for interactions in a tenant

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables filtering by a condition.
Format for the filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*).
For more information, please see Filtering

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: This parameter represents a positive integer value to identify what element in a result set must be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: This parameter represents a positive integer value to identify the maximum number of interactions to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the offset parameter.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of properties from object structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial object. List of object properties you can find at the response model. Additional system properties are:
  • attributes._lookupCodes: return codes for lookup attributes.
  • attributes._lookupValues: return values for lookup attributes.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the interaction objects property that must be used for sorting. Can be used in combination with the order parameter to have the reverse order. If this parameter is not provided or if the value cannot be recognized, then no sorting is used.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the sort parameter. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • sendHidden - Specifies whether the hidden attributes will appear in the response

post.summary: Deletes a batch of interactions by interaction URIs from a tenant
post.description: This API deletes a batch of interactions by interaction URIs from a tenant, the max number of interaction URIs in one batch is 150

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
This is an optional parameter indicating whether interactions gets completely removed from the system or only flagged as deleted. The possible parameter values are:
  • soft (default)- interactions will only be marked as deleted with a special flag, but will not be physically removed
  • hard - interactions will be completely removed from storage

requestBody.description: A list of interaction URIs, the max number of interaction URIs in one request is 150

post.summary: Returns saved searches found by specified filtering, ordering and paging parameters
post.description:
You can search for saved searches that you own, or, those that are shared with everyone. The results of the search for saved searches depend upon the filtering, ordering and paging parameters specified in the request.
You can use the following fields as part of the Request body to search for some saved searches that match the specified criteria:
  • offset - The number of requests to skip from the beginning of the result set (useful for pagination)
  • max - The maximum number of records that can be listed in a page (page size)
  • startsWith - A letter or string with which the name of a saved search starts.
  • favoriteOnly - The filter that allows you to search for saved searches based on the setting of the isFavorite field.
  • sortBy - The option by which the search results can be sorted. You can set it to NAME, CREATE_DATE, or, UPDATE_DATE.
  • sortOrder - The order by which the search results can be sorted. You can set it as ASC for ascending order, or, DESC for descending order.
  • includes - The array of strings which are used to search by full equality of name. The search results that match the criteria mentioned in 'includes' are appended to each page besides the regular page size (max).

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: countResults
parameters.description: This parameter specifies whether the number of profiles found for each query must be displayed or not. This can be true or false. Set this parameter to true to display the number of results retrieved.

parameters.name: findPublic
parameters.description: This parameter sets the boundary for searching the saved searches. This can be true or false. If it is set to true, public saved searches are also searched.

post.summary: Create a saved search query
post.description:
Create saved search query creates a new saved search query. If you have administrative privileges, you can create saved searches for other users too within the same tenant.
While creating a saved search, you must specify a valid search query string and a name for saving the search. In addition, you can specify a description, set the saved search as a favorite by using the isFavorite flag, or, make it available for others by setting the isPublic flag.

You can use the following fields in the body of the request:
  • name - The Name of the search that is being saved.
  • description - A Desciption of the search that is being saved.
  • query - A valid search query string.
  • isFavorite - The flag for marking the saved search as a favorite. You can set it to true or false.
  • isPublic - The flag that specifies whether other users of the same tenant can use this request (in Read-only mode) or not. You can set it to true or false. If true, the saved search would be available to others.

    The following information is provided as part of the Response:
    • count - Number of profiles found by the Query.
    • uiState - A valid JSON, which is used for keeping the state of visual controls for query editing.
    • owner - The owner of the saved search.
    • createDate - The date on which the search was saved.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: onBehalfOf
parameters.description: Tenant administrators can specify the name of the user on whose behalf the saved search must be created.

put.description:
You can modify the details of a saved search only if you are the owner of that search. In addition, if you have administrative privileges, you can modify it for other users too within the same tenant.
While modifying an existing saved search, you can modify any of the following details:
  • name - The name of the saved search.
  • description - The desciption of the saved search.
  • query - The search query string used in the saved search.
  • isFavorite - The flag for marking the saved search as a favorite. You can set it to true or false.
  • isPublic - The flag that specifies whether other users of the same tenant can use this request (in Read-only mode) or not. You can set it to true or false. If true, the saved search would be available to others.


The following information is provided as part of the Response:
  • count - Number of profiles found by the Query.
  • uiState - A valid JSON, which is used for keeping the state of visual controls for query editing.
  • owner - The owner of the saved search.
  • createDate - The date on which the search was saved.
  • updateDate - The date on which the saved search is modified.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the saved search that must be modified.

parameters.name: onBehalfOf
parameters.description: Tenant administrators can specify the name of the user on whose behalf the saved search must be modified.

get.summary: Search or Get Relationships API
get.description:
This API searches for relationships by the start and/or end objects, attribute values, tags, or type. It can return non empty results in case when relation indexing is enabled in tenant configuration by indexRelations property. The response can include a maximum of 200 relationships.
If the request consists of the select parameter, then ensure that there is no space between the query parameters. For example: select=URI,label,attributes._lookupCodes,attributes._lookupValues

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables relationships filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*).
For more information, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of properties from object structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial object. List of object properties you can find at the response model. Additional system properties are:
  • attributes._lookupCodes: return codes for lookup attributes.
  • attributes._lookupValues: return values for lookup attributes.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of relationships to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "offset" parameter

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Relationship object's property that should be used for sorting. Can be used in combination with the "order" parameter to have reverse order. If this parameter is not provided or if the value cannot be recognized, then no sorting is used

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the sort parameter. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order
  • desc - results are shown in descending order

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • nonOvOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="false" will be present in the resulting JSON. This option is mutually exclusive with the ovOnly option. Has a lower priority than ovOnly
  • ovOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="true" will be present in the resulting JSON
  • searchByOv - Disabled by default, to search by attributes with Operational Values (OV) only.
  • sendHidden - Specifies whether the hidden attributes will appear in the response

parameters.name: defaultMaxValues
parameters.description: Specifies maximum number of values listed in attributes. This restriction is intended for more efficient responses in the case of very long lists of values in some attributes

parameters.name: scoreEnabled
parameters.description: When set to true, documents with search hits in labels get more search relevance score

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description:
Defines whether to include active and expired relationships into the results. By default, only active relationships are included in the response. Possible values:
  • all - include both active and expired relationships
  • active - include only active relationships
  • not_active - include only expired relationships

post.summary: Uploads a file with list of values to private bucket
post.description:
This API allows to upload a file with a list of values to internal cloud storage to use this file in the search filter later. It also provides temporary direct access to the file via presigned URL.

Note: Only TXT and CSV file extensions are supported. CSV file must contain only one column without a header.
Limitation for supported file size is 10MB or 5000 values.

uri.description: URI of Attribute
URI of Attribute

allOf.description: Nested Attribute is a object which can contain another interconnected attributes. NestedAttributeValueTO can contain NestedAttributeValueTO and SimpleAttributeValueTO.

startObjectCrosswalks.description: start objects crosswalks of reference attribute

uri.description: URI of Attribute

allOf.description: This object is combination of attributes of EntityTO and RelationTO. ReferenceAttributeValueTO can contain SimpleAttributeValueTO, NestedAttributeValueTO.

filter.description:
This parameter indicates a filter condition to filter activity log items.
The format is the same as that for the ActivityLogRecordsSearch request. For more information, see Filtering Activities

ActivityExportBody.description: Object containing the filter parameter for activity log export

exception.example: com.reltio.metadata.errors.CommonException:Code: OBJECT_NOT_FOUND; Message parameters: [entities/someId]. Object with id=entities/someId not found. No object with specified id found at com.reltio.businesslogic.crud.AbstractCRUDService.getBusinessObjects, line 633

groupId.description: This field denotes the Group ID of scheduled tasks for this export

exportType.description: This field denotes the type of the scheduled export

status.description: This field denotes the status of the export request

details.description: This field denotes the detailed status of the export request
details.example: Export job has been scheduled. Result will be sent to your email: user@example.com

taskIds.description: This field is an array containing the IDs of the scheduled tasks

version.description: This field denotes the version of the scheduled export

ovOnly.description: The possible values are true or false. If not specified or value is true, then only ov=true attributes are exported.

includeType.description: This parameter indicates a JSON array of entity types. If specified, only entities that belong to the specified types or extend those types are exported.

headerFormat.description: This parameter specifies how the Export Service must name the CSV header columns and is only applicable for CSV export. For more information see Parameters for CSV Headers in the Entities or Relations Export File.

headerOrder.description:
This parameter defines how CSV headers will be sorted in result files. Possible values:
  • DEFAULT
  • SELECT - if set the columns will be sorted using the order specified in the select parameter

filter.description: This parameter enables you to filter entities by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*). For more information, see Filtering Entities.

sliceFilter.description: It provides an ability to filter out individual slices generated by the slicedByCrosswalks parameter. This parameter is only applicable to the CSV export format and can only be used in combination with the slicedByCrosswalks parameter

EntitiesExportBody.description:
Object containing any of the following parameters for entities export:
  • ovOnly
  • includeType
  • updateTimeFilter
  • groupBy
  • headerFormat
  • headerOrder
  • filter
  • sliceFilter

attribute.description: A nested/reference attribute that needs to be grouped.

anchorAttributes.description:
A list of simple sub-attributes that will be used to group values of the complex (parent) attribute.
At least one sub-attribute is expected.
Only non-blob simple attributes can be specified as anchor attributes.

maxNumberOfUniqueValues.description:
A number that specifies how many unique values can be used to generate column sets.
The value should belong to the following interval [1, 2048], default value is 64.

MergeTreeExportBody.description:
This request supports the filtering of export data by date. The available options are startDate and endDate. These options consider the start and end date filters in the following formats:
  • Timestamp: number of milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970
  • YYYY-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ
  • MM-dd-YYYY HH.mm
If all the merges are filtered for a particular contributor, then that contributor node is removed from the report. This request also supports informing whether the exported file should be formatted as json array. For that it uses the parameter outputAsJsonArray which accepted true or false.

ovOnly.description: The possible values are true or false. If not specified or value is true, then only ov=true attributes are exported.

includeType.description: This parameter indicates a JSON array of relation types. If specified, only reltions that belong to the specified types or extend those types are exported.

headerFormat.description: This parameter specifies how the Export Service must name the CSV header columns and is only applicable for CSV export. For more information see Parameters for CSV Headers in the Entities or Relations Export File.

headerOrder.description:
This parameter defines how CSV headers will be sorted in result files. Possible values:
  • DEFAULT
  • SELECT - if set the columns will be sorted using the order specified in the select parameter

filter.description: This parameter enables you to filter relations by a condition. Format for filter parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*). For more information, see Relations Filtering.

sliceFilter.description: It provides an ability to filter out individual slices generated by the slicedByCrosswalks parameter. This parameter is only applicable to the CSV export format and can only be used in combination with the slicedByCrosswalks parameter

RelationsExportBody.description:
Object containing any of the following parameters for relations export:
  • ovOnly
  • includeType
  • updateTimeFilter
  • groupBy
  • headerFormat
  • headerOrder
  • filter
  • sliceFilter

id.description: Unique ID of the periodic task

groupId.description: Unique ID of periodic task group

createdBy.description: ID of a user who created this task

createdTime.description: Timestamp when the task was created

updatedBy.description: ID of a user who updated this task (e.g. who canceled/paused the task)

updatedTime.description: Timestamp when task was most recently updated

startTime.description: Time when the task was started

stopTime.description: Time when the task was stopped

taskParams.description: A set of parameters of the periodic task

createdOnHost.description: Host name of API node where the task was created

executedOnHost.description: Host name of API node where the task is executing/was executed

status.description: A status of the periodic tasks, possible statuses: SCHEDULED, PROCESSING, PAUSING, PAUSED, CANCELING, CANCELED, COMPLETED, FAILED, THROTTLING

statusChangedTime.description: Time when the task status was changed

currentState.description: Set of fields which represent the current state of task (e.g. numberOfProcessedObjects)

error.description: If periodic task failed, this attribute contains error description

internalErrorDetails.description: If periodic task failed, this attribute contains detailed error description

parentTaskId.description: Contains ID of parent periodic task for multi-step tasks

pausedTime.description: Time when the task was paused

totalPausedTime.description: Duration of time interval when task was paused

name.example: Re-cleansing of configuration/entityTypes/Location in tenant testTenant background task.

matchScopes.description:
You can choose to publish the model for tenant and external matching. If you select:
EXTERNAL_MATCH - the model is used to match data from an external file with the data in the tenant.
TENANT - the model is used to match the data within your tenant along with the match rules configured for the tenant. In the case, you can select the type of matching to be performed as shown below

useOvOnly.description: If set to true, restricts matching to only the OV within the attribute

actionThresholds.description: You can define a custom action and a corresponding relevance score range. This allows you to execute custom actions for relevance scores that are received for relevance-based rules. If a match pair falls within the defined range, then the custom action is executed

description.description: Description of the flow
description.example: Example

id.description: Unique identifier of Active Learning object

maxFlatRows.description: Maximum appropriate number of rows in the sampled table

samplingStrategy.description:
This property set the sampling strategy.
 OV_FIRST (default) - try to flatten all values in the tenant table. If the flattened table size exceeds the maxFlatRows limit try using OV values only. If the flattened table is still too big, try taking fewer entities (but not less than minSampleSize)
SAMPLING_FIRST -  try to flatten all values in the tenant table. If the flattened table size exceeds the maxFlatRows limit, try taking fewer entities. If you have to take less than minSampleSize, try taking the OV values only as a fallback strategy

minSampleSize.description: Minimum number of entities to participate in feature generation

type.description: This action will be taken on the matched pair

threshold.description: This range of relevance score for selected matched action. It is recommended not to have intervals when defining relevance score ranges for multiple actions in the format [lowerRange-upperRange] where lowerRange < upperRange and the values should be between 0 and 1. For example, if you have a range 0.5 to 1 for one action, then keep the upper limit as 0.5 for the lower range of the next action
